description.en: No restrictions; No contract law or licenses required
description.ru: No restrictions; No contract law or licenses required

description.en: Phobited: Poison gas, explosives, undetectable weapons, weapons of mass destruction, battle dress (C5); Optional registration of private agreements, claim registration
description.ru: Phobited: Poison gas, explosives, undetectable weapons, weapons of mass destruction, battle dress (C5); Optional registration of private agreements, claim registration

description.en: Phobited: Portable energy and laser weapons, combat armour; Registration of corporations, enforcement of claims
description.ru: Phobited: Portable energy and laser weapons, combat armour; Registration of corporations, enforcement of claims

description.en: Phobited: Military weapons (all portable heavy weapons), flak jackets and obvious armour (C4); Basic permitting and zoning laws, required licensing of corporations and tax reporting, bankruptcy law
description.ru: Phobited: Military weapons (all portable heavy weapons), flak jackets and obvious armour (C4); Basic permitting and zoning laws, required licensing of corporations and tax reporting, bankruptcy law

description.ru: Phobited: Light assault weapons and submachine guns (all fully automatic weapons), cloth armour (C3); Registration of professional licenses, periodic random auditing of major financial transactions

description.en: Phobited: Personal concealable ranged weapons (auto pistols and revolvers), mesh armour; Required professional licenses for most skilled professions

description.en: Phobited: All firearms except shotguns and stunners; carrying weapons discouraged; Moderate permitting and zoning laws, registration fees required for professional licenses
description.ru: Phobited: All firearms except shotguns and stunners; carrying weapons discouraged; Moderate permitting and zoning laws, registration fees required for professional licenses

description.en: Phobited: Shotguns and all other ranged firearms (C2); Professional licenses required for all skilled labour, periodic auditing of major financial transactions
description.ru: Phobited: Shotguns and all other ranged firearms (C2); Professional licenses required for all skilled labour, periodic auditing of major financial transactions

description.en: Phobited: All bladed weapons, stunners, all visible armour (C1); Restrictive zoning and permitting laws
description.ru: Phobited: All bladed weapons, stunners, all visible armour (C1); Restrictive zoning and permitting laws

description.en: Phobited: All weapons, including knives longer than 10cm, all armour; Active auditing of all financial transactions
description.ru: Phobited: All weapons, including knives longer than 10cm, all armour; Active auditing of all financial transactions

description.en: All Weapons violations are treated as Serious crimes; Arduous permitting and zoning laws
description.ru: All Weapons violations are treated as Serious crimes; Arduous permitting and zoning laws

description.en: Random sweeps for weapons violations; Continuous auditing of all financial transactions
description.ru: Random sweeps for weapons violations; Continuous auditing of all financial transactions

description.en: Active monitoring for ownership violations; All economic regulation enforcement transferred to criminal justice system; Rigid control of civilian movement
description.ru: Active monitoring for ownership violations; All economic regulation enforcement transferred to criminal justice system; Rigid control of civilian movement

description.en: All facets of daily life regularly ligislated and regulated
description.ru: All facets of daily life regularly ligislated and regulated

description.en:
An 'A' code is assigned to excellent-quality installations, usually with construction yards attached. The size of a port’s shipyards can vary considerably. Small-ship construction is commonplace, building vessels of common types up to 1,000 tons or so. Some ports can build larger vessels but many such craft are built at specialist yards. These may or may not be co-located with a major starport but the facility will need a port of some kind.
A Class A port can conduct starship overhauls and modifications, and sells both refined and unrefined fuel.
description.ru:
An 'A' code is assigned to excellent-quality installations, usually with construction yards attached. The size of a port’s shipyards can vary considerably. Small-ship construction is commonplace, building vessels of common types up to 1,000 tons or so. Some ports can build larger vessels but many such craft are built at specialist yards. These may or may not be co-located with a major starport but the facility will need a port of some kind.
A Class A port can conduct starship overhauls and modifications, and sells both refined and unrefined fuel.

description.en: Code B is assigned to large or high-quality (sometimes but not always both) installations. Ports serving systems that see a lot of interstellar traffic usually grow into a Class B installation. To qualify for this code, a starport must be capable of conducting maintenance and overhauls, and must have facilities for refining starship fuel. It will usually have yards capable of constructing non-starships such as shuttles and launches. Class B ports are often important trade centres.
description.ru: Code B is assigned to large or high-quality (sometimes but not always both) installations. Ports serving systems that see a lot of interstellar traffic usually grow into a Class B installation. To qualify for this code, a starport must be capable of conducting maintenance and overhauls, and must have facilities for refining starship fuel. It will usually have yards capable of constructing non-starships such as shuttles and launches. Class B ports are often important trade centres.

description.en: Code C is assigned to 'average' starports, which can vary considerably. To qualify, a port must have at least a basic orbital facility, although this might be nothing more than a docking station with a shuttle service planetside. Both refined and unrefined fuel are usually available but starship building facilities are highly unlikely to be present, and only fairly basic maintenance or repairs are possible.
description.ru: Code C is assigned to 'average' starports, which can vary considerably. To qualify, a port must have at least a basic orbital facility, although this might be nothing more than a docking station with a shuttle service planetside. Both refined and unrefined fuel are usually available but starship building facilities are highly unlikely to be present, and only fairly basic maintenance or repairs are possible.

description.en: Code D is assigned to a very basic port. A Class D port is almost always a downport with no orbital component at all. Only unrefined fuel is available and no repair facilities are on offer; what facilities there are may be quite primitive.
description.ru: Code D is assigned to a very basic port. A Class D port is almost always a downport with no orbital component at all. Only unrefined fuel is available and no repair facilities are on offer; what facilities there are may be quite primitive.

description.en: Code E indicates what is often termed a 'frontier installation'. A Class E port can be nothing more than a ‘usual place to land’ or a known safe area. There are no facilities as such, although there might be a settlement close by where ad-hoc services can be obtained.
description.ru: Code E indicates what is often termed a 'frontier installation'. A Class E port can be nothing more than a ‘usual place to land’ or a known safe area. There are no facilities as such, although there might be a settlement close by where ad-hoc services can be obtained.

description.en: This is assigned to a high-quality port capable of handling a large volume of traffic. Class F spaceports usually have facilities equivalent to a Class B starport or perhaps a high-end C. A few are as large and capable as Class A ports and may have additional facilities such as large shipyards or a naval base. Class F ports often serve large cities on a planet with a central starport, or important offworld installations, such as colonies and the like.
description.ru: This is assigned to a high-quality port capable of handling a large volume of traffic. Class F spaceports usually have facilities equivalent to a Class B starport or perhaps a high-end C. A few are as large and capable as Class A ports and may have additional facilities such as large shipyards or a naval base. Class F ports often serve large cities on a planet with a central starport, or important offworld installations, such as colonies and the like.

description.en: A G-code is assigned to a basic or fairly poor spaceport, equivalent to the lower end of Class C or better than average Class D starports. A Class G port is likely to be found at a minor city or typical offworld asset such as a mining base on a gas giant moon.
description.ru: A G-code is assigned to a basic or fairly poor spaceport, equivalent to the lower end of Class C or better than average Class D starports. A Class G port is likely to be found at a minor city or typical offworld asset such as a mining base on a gas giant moon.

description.en: An H-code is typically assigned to a very basic or improvised facility equivalent to a low-end Class D port, or simply a landing area next to a small or temporary installation. A scientific outpost with a dozen personnel, which receives a supply ship once every three months, would probably have Class H port.
description.ru: An H-code is typically assigned to a very basic or improvised facility equivalent to a low-end Class D port, or simply a landing area next to a small or temporary installation. A scientific outpost with a dozen personnel, which receives a supply ship once every three months, would probably have Class H port.

description.en: Code X applies to worlds with no port at all, such as unexplored, interdicted and uninhabited worlds. Not only are there no port facilities, there is no guarantee that a landing site will be safe. Ground subsidence, flooding and other problems can make an apparently useable site hazardous.
description.ru: Code X applies to worlds with no port at all, such as unexplored, interdicted and uninhabited worlds. Not only are there no port facilities, there is no guarantee that a landing site will be safe. Ground subsidence, flooding and other problems can make an apparently useable site hazardous.

description.en: Code Y indicates no spaceport is present. The starport equivalent code, Class X, can also be used.
description.ru: Code Y indicates no spaceport is present. The starport equivalent code, Class X, can also be used.
